Mailroom Supervisor

Company Name PwC Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 59 minutes ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Flexible work options - work smarter in a way that suits your lifestyle.
  • 18 weeks paid parental leave - for mum, dad & foster carers.
  • Develop your career in a firm of opportunity

The Opportunity

At PwC, we help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From improving healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting Australia’s start up industry, you’ll build trust in society and solve important problems.

The mailroom supervisor will oversee and manage all mailroom functions including mail, courier and stationery functions, focussing on customer service, attention to detail, and being a flexible part of a diverse team.

You will
  • Interview, recruit and induct new staff, and manage staff performance accordingly.
  • Coordinate staffing levels to ensure business needs are met
  • Organise regular team meetings to keep staff abreast of projects, workload and resourcing matters
  • Support and manage projects specific to your team whilst encouraging your team to participate in design and implementation where necessary
  • Review processes and procedures to ensure the most efficient and effective delivery of service and make recommendations where enhancement is required
  • Manage WH&S issues to ensure a safe & healthy working environment

About You

The brief is simple...

You have minimum of two years experience in a supervisor role in a corporate environment with strong client service focus, and intermediate knowledge of Microsoft office suite. You demonstrate technical aptitude, have a proactive nature and are capable of working under pressure in deadline driven environment with flexibility to meet business requirements.

You thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture and want to join a firm that values problem solvers, the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and key stakeholders.

Your colleagues can vouch that you
  • Act with integrity and show care for the people you work with
  • Demonstrate an ability to work effectively as part of a team
  • Have excellent client service and interpersonal communication skills both written and oral
  • Have high attention to detail
  • Show potential to think on your feet and solve problems
  • Have ability to work effectively and lead a team

Sound like you? Read on.

What We Offer

Working for Australia’s largest professional services firm you’ll join a global network spanning 157 countries that delivers meaningful outcomes for a wide range of clients.

Our culture and benefits are why we’re LinkedIn’s number one Australian workplace. With state of the art offices and premium technology, each person has access to flexible work options. The dress policy is flexible too – you choose what you wear based on the work you do with your team and clients.

Fostering an inclusive culture and embracing differences is at the core of everything we do. PwC empowers you to be yourself and work with people from many backgrounds to achieve things never thought possible. Get involved in our employee-led diversity networks (cultural, disability, LGBTI or gender equality) and benefit from our best-in-class policies such as 18 weeks maternity/paternity leave, flexible work and gender equity.

Up for a challenge? We’re committed to helping our people unleash their potential. Hard work doesn’t go unrewarded and industry best coaching, mentoring, training and development are ready and waiting. If you hold a genuine desire to make a difference and want to surround yourself with like-minded, talented and driven individuals who strive to do the same , apply now .

PwC is committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce. Our Reconciliation Action Plan sets out our commitment to increase Indigenous employment. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians.

Evalyne Findanis is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

884253725:
[

Neonatal Intensive Care - Registered Nurses, Melbourne

Company Name Mercy Health Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We are seeking experienced Neonatal Nurses to join our team at Mercy Hospital for Women in Melbourne – the second most liveable city in the world. We are a Tertiary Public Hospital with a 61 bed “state-of-the-art” Neonatal Unit comprising of a Level 6 Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (highest level in Australia) and a Special Care Nursery.

About The Roles

Are you a NICU nurse who is keen to become part of an innovative and supportive team, and contribute to innovative Neonatal Intensive Care using modern technologies and medical strategies to provide excellent clinical care of the patients in Neonatal Services? You will attend high risk deliveries and provide best practice evidence based care for the best outcomes of our neonates. You will actively participate in the ward round to collaborate care for the patient. You will be assured by our 24/7 neonatal consultant cover. Many of our nurses choose to have their babies here knowing the excellent reputation of the Mercy Hospital for Women Neonatal Services
  • Located at Mercy Hospital for Women in the suburb of Heidelberg, Melbourne
  • Permanent full-time and part-time positions available, fixed term contracts also available
  • Work in a bright and friendly environment, with autonomy and great teamwork
  • Provide and implement high quality individualised clinical care for premature and sick babies and their families
  • Play an integral role in a motivated clinical team with a strong family centred care approach
  • You will be offered excellent professional development opportunities
  • Involves working across all rostered shifts
  • Fortnightly pay and attractive salary
  • Visa sponsorship available for successful applicants, if required
We have a culture of teamwork and inclusiveness, and would love you to join us!

About Us

Mercy Hospital for Women is a fully accredited Level 6 public teaching hospital in obstetrics & gynaecology, neonatology, anaesthetics and gynaecological oncology. We are a specialist referral centre with the medical, nursing, midwifery and allied health expertise to treat the most complex obstetric, neonatal and gynaecological cases. This hospital is located in the leafy suburb of Heidelberg, 18 km north-east of Melbourne's Central Business District and conveniently directly opposite Heidelberg Train Station.

Mercy Health is a Catholic organisation employing over 8500 people who provide compassionate and holistic care through our acute hospitals, aged care facilities, mental health programs, palliative and respite services, maternity and women’s health services, early parenting services and home care services.
Mercy Health is proud to be recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the WGEA.

About You
  • Current Registration as a Registered Nurse with the Nursing Council of New Zealand
  • Eligibility for Registration as a Registered Nurse with the Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (AHPRA)
  • You have completed a Post Graduate Certificate in Neonatal Intensive Care, OR
  • You have at least 1 year experience in Level 6 (highest tertiary level) NICU
  • You are committed to clinical excellence
  • Demonstrated time management and organisational skills
  • Ability to establish rapport with families
What We Offer
  • Values driven culture
  • Salary packaging benefits
  • Leadership Capability Framework to support your career progression and development
  • Camp Australia School Holiday Program
  • Thrive @ Mercy – our health & wellbeing hub supporting you to be the best you can be
  • Stepping Stones – our flexibility framework supporting your growth and work life balance
  • Fully funded childcare referral service
To find out more about these exciting initiatives, please visit Mercy Health Careers homepage (http//careers.mercy.com.au/)

At Mercy Health we pride ourselves on embracing diversity and foster an inclusive culture where individual differences are respected and celebrated. We encourage applications from people of all ages, abilities and cultural backgrounds including Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Peoples.

884535145:
[

Curriculum Manager - National Training

Company Name Teach For Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 67 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Teach For Australia
Teach For Australia (TFA) is an innovative non-profit organisation and part of a global movement dedicated to developing leadership in classrooms and communities to ensure all children achieve their potential.

\xa0

All students have the capacity to succeed in their educational pursuits, but there is inequity between educational outcomes of students from different backgrounds. In Australia, children from the lowest income households are on average three years behind in school. Without addressing this inequity, the gap grows over time and, if carried on to the next generation of students, a cycle of educational disadvantage is created.

\xa0

We recruit Australia’s future leaders and inspire, connect and empower them to a lifetime of action to achieve educational equity. Our vision is of an Australia where all children, regardless background, attain an excellent education.

\xa0

About the Team

The National Curriculum Team works collaboratively with our university partner to design and deliver a fully integrated Leadership Development Program (LDP) that includes a Master of Teaching qualification. The team leads in the design of each core component of the Leadership Development Program, including university content, face to face residential intensives, coaching and mentoring.

\xa0

About the Job

This role leads the design and delivery of a comprehensive, multi-week National Initial Intensive program designed to effectively prepare LDP participants for two-year teaching placements, as well as later week long regional intensive events, held throughout the remainder of the program. The role coordinates with university staff in developing a program that integrates academic course requirements and oversees each element of delivery of National Initial Intensive, including management of the team of facilitators responsible for program delivery.

\xa0

This job is for you if…

  • You are passionate about TFAs mission, are a strong fit with our core values, and want to be part of an ambitious organization.
  • You are energetic, and are energized by working collaboratively with like-minded people.
  • You have experience designing and delivering high quality professional learning for teachers and/or leaders.
  • You have strong expertise and a proven track record of improving educational outcomes for students, particularly those from low SES backgrounds.

Job description

About the Role:


As part of our ongoing commitment to providing the best \xa0level of service to our customer, we are looking for an experienced and motivated Field Leader – Faults and Underground to join the Powercor Network Services team.


Reporting to Field Operations Manager - You will manage and lead team of employees, contractors and service providers with underground and test technical skillsets to meet network services and client requirements as measured by health, safety, environmental, schedule, quality and cost metrics. While delivering the above piece of work you will also have responsibility for managing a service faults team with overhead skill sets. This team will also need to meet allocated programs of work in line with the same principles as above.


You will also deliver the Underground (and tests) fields works program (construction, maintenance and works) allocated to the group while also managing a service faults team with overhead skill sets.

\xa0

Key duties and responsibilities:

\xa0

  • Provide local leadership for the depot and manage related customer and stakeholder communications
  • Support the Field Operations Manager – In overall business strategy for the work group, operational decisions and fostering an overall high performing team
  • Provide expert oversight for project scoping, planning, materials management and resolution of technical issues
  • Be a strong role model and champion of our HSE values, and commitment to safety
  • Be a strong role model and change champion through a period of change for the workgroup and the wider Group Resources team

With your strong communication and coaching skills, you will also bring:


  • Management or leadership related qualifications or an equivalent working experience in a similar field leadership type role (team leader, supervisor, work group leader etc.)
  • Qualifications/Certifications in an electrical distribution trade
  • Previous experience in construction, maintenance and technically related activities related to the electrical network
  • Overhead distribution construction or design experience would be desirable
  • Previous experience in Project / Contract Management with the ability to apply project management principles in an electrical distribution construction environment
  • Demonstrated strength influencing and negotiating with blue collar workforces, Unions and Management stakeholders
  • Proven track record and experience of financial accountability analysing operational and management reports, and driving effective delivery of organisational KPI’s
  • Strong interpersonal and highly developed communication skills
  • Demonstrated leadership experience, fostering a collaborative and high performing technically skilled blue collar team


If you possess the required skills and experience and you are looking for your next career opportunity please submit your application by C.O.B Wednesday 10 October 2018.

\xa0

OUR VALUES: Live safely, Be Customer and Community Minded, Succeed Together, Be The Best You Can Be, Improve Our Business

The role requires a high level of organisation with superior level of time management. The role offers a variety of responsibilities, high levels of autonomy and future growth.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide administrative support to General Manager:
Arrange appointments, meetings and events; including venues, travel arrangements and accommodation and processing claims for expenses. Provide support for an extensive range of meetings; including preparing agendas, pre-meeting briefings and meeting papers, noting action points and following them up. Receive and handle unsolicited telephone calls professionally, re-directing or taking messages and using initiative to deal with queries.

Provide financial insights and assist with reporting:
Build and maintain logical and reliable financial reports (intermediate Excel skills required) for input to planning process and key decision making. Ability to develop business cases using sound financial management techniques and business reasoning. Ability to complete and oversee End of Month reporting and proofreading before submission to General Manager for final endorsement and corporate submission.

Producing communications, presentations and reporting:
Ability to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles, including Power Point presentations and business cases. Develop monthly/quarterly operational, financial, board and risk report drafts for senior management. Proofread correspondence and documents prepared by the executive prior to final production and circulation. Research and/or gather relevant data on specific directed topics to enable the executive to respond to issues and/or write reports.

Ensure systems and processes are adhered to:
Ensure processes and policies are adhered to and look for opportunities to improve processes. Timesheets are completed within prescribed timeframes. All knowledge captured in relevant systems.

WHAT YOU'LL BRING:

  • Experience supporting executives and senior level management; or an equivalent combination of relevant work experience and education/training.
  • Excellent attention to detail, including proof reading skills, with the ability to maintain a high level of accuracy.
  • Demonstrated ability to work accurately and maintain high levels of productivity without close supervision.
  • A flexible, pro-active approach to work including the ability to prioritise and re-prioritise to achieve successful outcomes.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, written and verbal communication skills with a positive can-do outlook, displaying resilience and a calm manner under pressure.
  • Ability to assimilate large quantities of written and verbal communication quickly and produce accurate, timely minutes.
  • Knowledge and experience of the health and community services sector is highly desirable.


If you're looking for your next challenge, apply now!

Business Planning Manager

Company Name Australia Post Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 158 views

Job description

Summary

Be responsible for developing, facilitating and implementing the GTM model (sales operating model) for Business & Government to deliver the annual sales plan.

Overview

Australia Post is changing at an incredible pace. In the Business and Government department, we’ve integrated technological services that help large organisations and government departments adapt in an increasingly digital world without relegating on our historically successful offering of parcels and mail - all of which helps move Australia forward.

And we’re only getting started.

Nowadays, our plans are to lead the enterprise, business and government service space by encompassing our full range of products. And to get there, we’re on the lookout for ambitious people to join our truly diverse team. Working within a start-up culture that’s backed by all the resources Australia Post provides, the opportunity to innovate and push boundaries to improve services for all Australians is ready and waiting.

What's the job involve?

The Business & Planning role is responsible for developing, facilitating and implementing the GTM model (sales operating model) for Business & Government to deliver the annual sales plan. This role would see you work closely with senior stakeholders across the business to ensure buy-in to the sales plan and subsequent resourcing and forecast planning. You would be responsible from an enterprise perspective for sales governance to drive revenue performance and prioritisation of resources. In addition, this role would see you engage with stakeholders across Business & Government to ensure a cohesive, planned and prioritised framework for sales that supports the overall strategy.

What It's Like To Work Here

For you, it means you'll do great work, learn from the best and develop a career within a robust and well-invested but empowering and creative environment. We all work hard – we're working on major challenges, after all – but we also recognise that you have a life outside of the office, so we provide flexible conditions that enable you to grow whilst enjoying genuine work life balance.

We’re Looking For Someone With
  • Extensive experience in a planning role within a commercial environment.
  • Sales Management and Sales Operations experience (desirable).
  • Strong relationship management skills.
  • A clear understanding of business priorities.
  • Experience delivering strategic business plans, operational execution plans, and sales strategies.
  • Significant experience negotiating with internal stakeholders and influencing cooperation in order to drive business outcomes.

We see our culture just as important and therefore the successful candidate will display:
  • Excellent decision making ability.
  • Highly driven with a passion for results.
  • Be service focused in everything they do.
  • Are willing to take on feedback and strive for continuous improvement.


Benefits & Culture

Technical skills are important, however they are not everything.

We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in our people. We encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, cultures and disabilities. A career at Australia Post Group can lead down many paths and we are passionate about offering a supportive, inclusive culture, competitive compensation and flexible working conditions that enable you to develop whilst enjoying genuine work life balance.

To register your interest with our passionate careers team, please apply and remember to upload your details and your most recent resume.

Mirvac’s Office and Industrial business (O&I) creates and manages world-class workspaces, office buildings and city precincts for Australia’s leading organisations. Product Managers/Designers

Company Name ME Bank Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 18 views

Job description


Let's talk about ME
We're not like other banks.

ME was created by the industry super funds to be different from the pack \xad- and we're passionate about staying that way as we head into an exciting and progressive future. We are building a bank, a company and a brand that we can be proud of - but to achieve that, we need the best people.

To help ME get there, you'll challenge the status quo and share extraordinary ideas - and our size guarantees you'll have the opportunity, support and environment to be heard.

ME's core purpose is helping all Australians get ahead - no conditions, asterisks or exceptions.

We believe everyone deserves the same opportunities in life, regardless of gender or identity, sexuality, ethnicity or religion. This is why we're so committed to an equal opportunity workplace - because we know our success won't come from focusing on similarities, but by embracing and celebrating our diversity.

Let's talk about the JOB
Reporting to the Product Design Lead, you will be responsible for working across the bank to create and deliver simple, transparent, competitively priced products flawlessly and in alignment with ME's core purpose of helping all Australian's get ahead.

Our product manager roles have ownership and accountability aligned to our core products- term deposits, personal loans, or home loans.

Your initial focus will be to deliver on strategic product changes to re-platform the product suite and help make for smoother, frictionless operations across the product value chain. As the product SME, you will continue to optimise products and product processes through data and insights, whilst ensuring the product portfolio is well managed in accordance with best practice product management disciplines.

You will lead the development and delivery of a detailed product roadmap, encompassing strategic future thought and the development of a market leading product proposition. You will have end to end product accountability, focusing on leading and optimising growth, retention and profitability trade off.

Adapting a continuous improvement lens, you'll work collaboratively with key stakeholders across the organisation, while utilising your understanding of process design and implementation as it relates to product fulfilment.

Let's talk about YOU
You're a product aficionado, with sound product development experience and key understanding of the P/L drivers within the financial services sector. Delivering customer centric solutions are at the heart of all you do and you get all warm and fuzzy at the thought of helping all Australians get ahead.

You pride yourself on your commercial acumen, most particularly, your ability to create commercial strategies and undertake business casing. Customer segmentation is not a foreign term and you're up to date with regulatory and technological trends. You'll have a level of comfort with scaled agile and well developed stakeholder management skills with the ability to consult and influence effectively both internally and externally.

About the Perks
At ME, we believe that work should be a place that you can make the most of - and these are just some of the many reasons why people love it here:

  • Popular culture - that's not a claim, we've got the data to prove it. We genuinely care about each other and work in an encouraging and collaborative environment.
  • The whole package - sure, we're going to reward you well with your salary package - but there are also lots of other perks - including discounted Myki travel cards, free health support, conveniently-located offices, plus much more.
  • Not afraid to fail? We embrace action-oriented people like you. That's right, you can make mistakes here and it's ok - so long as you learn from them.
  • To be ME, we need you - we're building something really cool and you get to directly influence what that is.
  • ProudlyME - our internal pride network - has a swag of initiatives that show support, education, and passion toward our team and customers, demonstrating that ME is a strong advocate on equal rights for the LGBTIQ+ community.
  • Meet the Execs - our Executive team is fun and full of passion because we know great managers mean happy staff.



Oh, and did we mention you get your very own ME branded Converse High-top shoes? Now that's a reason to get your foot in the door.

I want those Converse (and the job)!

 If this sounds like the perfect job for you, why wait? Apply now by submitting your cover letter and resume today.

CSIRO is seeking to appoint a Research Consultant within CSIRO Futures business unit. The Research Consultant will play a key role in delivering market research, analysis and consultation assistance. Company Name WSP in Australia & New Zealand Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 19 hours ago Number of views 19 views

Job description

At WSP we develop creative, comprehensive and sustainable engineering solutions for a future where society can thrive. Equipped with an intimate understanding of local intricacies, world-class talent and proactive leadership, we plan, design, manage and engineer long lasting and impactful solutions to uniquely complex problems. With 42,000 talented people in more than 500 offices across 40 countries, we engineer projects that will help societies grow for lifetimes to come

We are dedicated to our local communities and propelled by international brainpower. We are technical experts and strategic advisors including engineers, technicians, scientists, architects, planners, surveyors and environmental specialists, as well as other design, program and construction management professionals.

Here at WSP, we design lasting solutions in the Property & Buildings, Transportation & Infrastructure, Environment, Industry, Resources (including Mining and Oil & Gas) and Power & Energy sectors as well as project delivery and strategic consulting services.

Due to the continued success of our Australian operations and an internal promotion within our Power and Energy team, we are currently seeking to recruit a Lead for our Solar business to join our Power/ Renewable Energy team in Melbourne. It is a fantastic time to be part of our team as we move from strength to strength.

This role is ideal for those looking to take the next step in their career, transitioning from an engineering role to managing the solar capability and a dynamic team. Initially, the role will focus on the delivery of construction phase Owners Engineer services for utility-scale solar farms. However, it is envisaged that over time the role will evolve to one of technical oversight and increased responsibility for a portfolio of solar PV projects across Australia and management of the solar team and capability overall.

Preferred Qualifications/Experience
  • Qualified with an Electrical Engineering degree with 7 years’ experience, and a minimum of 5 years’ experience in similar roles. Mechanical/Civil/ other engineering degree will be considered if experienced in development/construction of utility-scale solar PV.
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience working in a professional services consulting environment.
  • Provision of owner’s engineering services.
  • Utility-scale solar/energy storage electrical design (AC and DC).
  • Knowledge of Australian and IEC standards electrical standards and good electricity supply industry practice.
  • Familiar with National Electricity Rules relating to the connection of generators.
  • Commissioning of utility-scale power plants.
  • Experience in conducting technical due diligence of proposed and existing assets on behalf of lenders, purchasers or developers.
Skills:
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Desire and capability to be in a client facing role.
  • Proven track record in managing complex projects from conception to completion.
  • Ability to effectively project manage and work with a national team of resources, taking responsibility for the quality of deliverables and meeting deadlines.
  • Desire and ability to provide leadership to junior staff as required.

With responsibilities ranging from presenting to customers and internal staff to conducting market and competitor research, the product manager role offers a variety of work and experience unlike most other positions.

Manager, Project Management Framework

Job description


About the Role


This is an outstanding opportunity for a Manager to develop our Project Management Framework (PMF) and subsequence governance for our Group Operations leadership team. Working across the portfolio of generation and gas operating plants and new developments, you will play a pivotal role in influencing key stakeholders to supporting our project management from feasibility through to execution.


Key Responsibilities


Reporting to the Head of Asset Services, you will work to drive all project improvement framework plans for our Group Operations projects.


Other responsibilities include (but not limited to):

  • Be an active contributor to the Group Operations Project Management and Group Operations Leadership team.
  • Determine and document the key requirements of the PMF across greenfield and brownfield projects.
  • Support the implementation of the action plan, including the stakeholder management plan.
  • Facilitate a regular forum of key stakeholders to review and improve the structure and content of the PMF.
  • Conduct a gap analysis and develop and improvement plan for the PMF in conjunction with key Stakeholders.
  • Manage reviews, updates and currency of the process, documents and tools within the PMF.
  • Maintain governance and assurance processes PMF in conjunction with our Asset Assurance.


About You


You will have extensive experience working in a project management gained from either a utilities, engineering or plant operational environment with:

  • tertiary qualification in engineering or similar qualification
  • qualifications in project management
  • exceptional collaboration, interpersonal and influencing skills
  • a proven track record in project managing large and complex projects


What's in it for you?
 You'll be working in an A-grade building with state of the art activity based working facilities. Being supported by our new flexible ways of working. We call it Smarter Working.

You'll get the opportunity to work with some of the most engaged and innovative in the business. Being exposed to more opportunities to advance your skills and career.

Working in a company the size of ours the sky's the limit for your career aspirations and we're focused on investing in you.


About us
 It truly is an exciting time to be part of AGL Energy as we lead the way in generating sustainable energy solutions for all Australians.

With a heritage of over 175 years and listed in the top 50 companies on the ASX, AGL offers a genuinely diverse, safe and supportive work environment, where "actions not words" fosters a culture of achievement and personal development.



Come with us on a journey of exploration and creativity, doing the same things differently, better, faster by encompassing innovation and passion for a more sustainable world.

883724861:
[

Manager Stakeholder Engagement and Communications

Company Name WorkSafe Victoria Company Location Geelong

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 206 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At WorkSafe we are dedicated to supporting all Victorians to be healthy and safe at work and to recover from any workplace injury or illness as quickly as possible. Our passion for safety and wellbeing is what unites us.

The Legislation, Policy and Information Services Division (LPIS) develops and maintains the laws administered by WorkSafe. LPIS provides strategic policy advice on OHS and Workers Compensation issues and contributes to national policy forum. The Division also develops codes, guidance and information materials to support duty holder compliance with Victoria's OHS and workers compensation legislation.

About the role

The Manager, Stakeholder Engagement and Communications is responsible for defining, developing and implementing effective stakeholder engagement and communications to support the activities of the Legislation, Policy and Information Services Division.

The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and subsequently driving acceptance of a variety projects and initiatives with a broad range of external and internal stakeholders. Previous demonstrated experience operating in a similar landscape is preferred.

Key Responsibilities
  • Managing the development and implementation of an effective strategy for engaging stakeholders throughout the life of any legislative reform projects
  • Developing, managing and maintaining effective internal and external stakeholder relationships
  • Monitoring and evaluating the effectiveness of stakeholder engagement and communications strategies
  • Providing leadership and strategic advice on the process and content for stakeholder engagement and communications
  • Managing the development and implementation of communications materials
  • Identifying and managing stakeholder issues, risks and opportunities, providing proactive and reactive advice and support across the Division and other areas of the business

Skills & experience
  • Demonstrated significant experience liaising in a professional manner with a diverse stakeholder group including senior management, employer groups, unions and internal stakeholders
  • Exceptional formal communication skills (written and verbal) and a demonstrated eye for detail
  • Ability to undertake effective research and analysis and produce accurate briefs and material
  • Experience in developing communications plans, messages and materials. Excellent ability to build effective working relationships, with highly developed influencing and negotiation skills
  • Ability to undertake effective research and analysis and produce accurate briefs and material
  • Excellent time management, prioritisation and organisational skills and an ability to meet tight deadlines

Benefits & culture

We pride ourselves on being a great place to work and offer flexibility to facilitate work/life balance. People who are seeking part-time or job share arrangements are encouraged to apply.

In return we offer a range of great benefits, including work variety, workplace flexibility and leave options, learning and development opportunities, study support, a leading health and wellbeing program, contribution to gym memberships and prescription eye wear and discounted corporate health insurance rates. WorkSafe prides itself on being a great place to work.

No applications from recruitment agencies will be accepted.

Only people with the right to work in Australia may apply for this position. You may be required to undergo a National Police Check (and Medical Assessment) as part of the recruitment process.

Applications close at midnight on Monday 8 October 2018. Click the link to apply, and join us in making a difference to Victorian lives.

For further enquiries please contact Georgina Ross, Talent Acquisition Specialist on 03 9641 1458.

WorkSafe are striving to build a diverse workforce that reflects the Victorian community we serve.
